According to the MoH, Sri Lanka from 26th October 2021 all travelers require a negative COVID-19 PCR test report (regardless of vaccination status), obtained within 72 hours of embarkation (excluding children below 2 years). Furthermore;    1.	Fully vaccinated travelers are considered those adults who have completed 14 days after the recommended doses of COVID-19 vaccination or children of 12-18 years, if depart two weeks after obtaining at least a single dose of Pfizer Vaccine. Fully vaccinated individuals need to show proof of vaccination (certificate, card etc) and DO NOT require an on-arrival PCR test.   2.	Unvaccinated or not fully vaccinated are considered those adults who are not vaccinated and/or departed from abroad within less than 2 weeks of completion of recommended doses of vaccination travelers. Travellers under this category will stay in the safety of the Tourism Bio Bubble until the completion of 14 days post vaccination period / 7 days after arrival (whichever comes first). The travellers are allowed to visit approved tourist sites and use all facilities of the hotel upon negative results of the on-arrival Day 1PCR test.   3.	No on-arrival PCR test for Not-vaccinated children up to 12 years and they will be allowed to travel with their parents.   4.	Not-vaccinated children of 12 -18 years need to undergo on-arrival Day 1 PCR testing at the Ministry of Health approved laboratory at BIA or at any other MOH approved laboratory and inform the result to the area MOH. If the PCR test report is negative, they will be allowed to travel with their parents. No 2nd PCR for fully vaccinated travellers.  5.	If Day 1 PCR testing results are positive then:  -	Sri Lnakan /Dual nationals/ Resident Visa Holders can isolate at home/hospital  -	Foreign national must isolate at designated intermediate care centre/hospitals.    6.	Exit PCR/Rapid Antigen Test must be preformed by all unvaccinated or not fully vaccinated     Please see below web archive link:     https://web.archive.org/web/20211026081252/http://www.health.gov.lk/moh_final/english/public/elfinder/files/feturesArtical/2021/2021-10-25-Quarantie%20Measures%20for%20Travellers.pdf
